In 1998, Michael Jordan laced up a pair of his iconic black and red Air Jordan 13s to bring home a Bulls victory during Game 2 of his final NBA championship — and now they are the most expensive sneakers ever to sell at auction.

Meanwhile, the Israel-Hamas ceasefire continues to hold as thousands of Palestinians head back to northern Gaza after four Israeli soldiers were released under the agreement. Ramy Inocencio reports.

222.title: President Trump ramps up deportation efforts as tensions flare with Colombia
222.summary: President Trump ramped up immigration enforcement with a series of raids and detentions in multipe cities and sending hundreds of undocumented migrants on military flights. After Colombia refused to accept the deportations, Mr. Trump threatened tariffs, forcing the Colombian president to back down. Ed O'Keefe reports from the White House.

223.title: With organic cotton, India bets on textile industry's green transition
223.summary: India is the world's leading organic cotton producer, controlling 51 percent of global production. The country has set its sights on becoming a major player in the textile industry's green transition – a market that's projected to grow 10 percent by 2026. However, to succeed in making a long-term commitment to sustainable fashion, the country must overcome logistical challenges and ensure effective control over organic certifications. Currently, only 2 percent of the country's cotton production is certified as organic. For many farmers, switching to organic cotton remains a significant financial risk. FRANCE 24's Selma Daoui and Nabeel Ahmed report.
223.author: Selma DAOUI

224.title: The 'Mona Lisa' will get its own room under a major renovation of the Louvre
224.summary: Emmanuel Macron made a visit on Tuesday to the "bedside" of an ailling museum. The biggest and most visited museum in the world, according to a leaked memo from the museum's director to the culture minister, is falling into disrepair. The president put a positive spin on it on Tuesday, announcing a vast renovation project, for a new and improved Louvre.
224.author: FRANCE24

225.title: Serbia's populist prime minister resigns after anti-corruption protests
225.summary: Serbia's prime minister Milos Vucevic announced his resignation on Tuesday. The outgoing PM was the former mayor of Novi Sad where the collapse of a freshly renovated roof of a train station killed 15 people, sparking massive anti-corruption protests.
225.author: FRANCE24

226.title: Student protestors unfazed by PM Vucevic resignation, demanding Serbia 'become a different society'
226.summary: Students in Serbia vowed to continue protesting even after the country's Prime Minister Milos Vucevic announced his resignation on Tuesday, following weeks of mass demonstrations over the fatal collapse of a train station roof in November. For in-depth analysis and a deeper perspective on students' demand for "action", FRANCE 24's Sharon Gaffney welcomes Dr. Helena Ivanov, Associate Research Fellow at the Henry Jackson Society.
226.author: FRANCE24

227.title: Gaza: 'Even if we return to rubble, at least we'll return to our homes'
227.summary: Tens of thousands of displaced Palestinians are continuing to make the long journey home to Northern Gaza. They're bracing for what awaits them there after 15 months of brutal bombardment and fighting. 70 per cent of buildings in the enclave are destroyed or badly damaged, and the north was hardest hit. But returnees say a home in ruins is better the camps they've been sheltering in.
227.author: FRANCE24

228.title: What would be the global impact of Trump administration's aid freeze?
228.summary: A federal judge temporarily blocked a push from President Donald Trump to pause federal funding while his administration conducts an across-the-board ideological review to uproot progressive initiatives. FRANCE 24's international affairs editor Kethevane Gorjestani has more about the global impact of this aid freeze.
228.author: FRANCE24

229.title: Federal judge temporarily blocks Trump administration freeze on federal grants
229.summary: A federal court has temporarily blocked a multibillion-dollar spending freeze enacted by the Trump administration that would have affected a vast range of programmes. Democrats condemned the freeze, describing it as unconstitutional, and saying it would have withdrawn funding from scientific research and charities and would have plunged the country into chaos. Oliver Farry has more.
229.author: FRANCE24

Plus, producers in Colombia are feeling some relief after Trump put the brakes on tariffs, but that hasn't stopped coffee prices from soaring.
231.author: Camille KNIGHT

232.title: Massive Ukrainian drone attack targets Russian power, oil facilities
232.summary: A massive Ukrainian drone attack targeted critical Russian energy infrastructure overnight, with Moscow saying that its air defence systems destroyed a drone attempting to hit a nuclear power facility in Smolensk on the Belarusian border. The governor of Belgorod region said that a drone attack had killed a mother and her two-year-old child.
232.author: FRANCE 24

238.summary: More than a dozen people were killed and many more injured in a crush at a huge religious festival in northern India's Uttar Pradesh state on Wednesday. District Judge Loren AliKhan cited "the spectre of irreparable harm" at an emergency hearing after an advocacy group argued the freeze would disrupt programs that serve tens of millions of Americans. Implementation of the funding freeze is on hold until Monday 5pm (22:00 GMT).
239.author: NEWS WIRES

241.title: African Union urges M23 rebels to 'lay down arms' in DR Congo
241.summary: In tonight's edition: The Congolese city of Goma is a canvas of violence and chaos since M23 rebels have entered the city. As Congolese forces struggle to hold out against the M23 and the Rwandan forces backing them, some of the civilians fleeing are heading over the border into Rwanda, the very country accused of enflaming the conflict.
241.author: Laura DI BIASIO

242.title: Putin says peace talks with Ukraine possible, but not with Zelensky

243.title: No, the Mona Lisa isn't being 'sold' to finance the Louvre renovations
243.summary: After French President Emmanuel Macron announced grand renovation plans for the Louvre museum in Paris, social media saw millions of views on a fake story about the star attraction – the Mona Lisa – being sold to finance the overhaul. The painting is not for sale, but is being moved to a new exhibition room. The falsehood originated from a French parody media, and spread further by a troll account who even joked about working at the parody company. Vedika Bahl debunks the false claim in Truth or Fake.

244.title: Boeing posts second-largest annual loss in its history

The company's stock, however, rallied after the latest financial results were announced, as investor focus turned to its recovery plan. Plus, Coca Cola has recalled several of its popular soft drinks including Coke, Fanta and Sprite in a number of European countries, after detecting higher-than-normal levels of chlorate.

245.title: Panic in Silicon Valley? China's DeepSeek challenges US supremacy over AI

The photo op put the rest of the world on notice: the billionaire tech bros of Silicon Valley reign supreme, with the full weight of the White House behind them. Fast forward to Monday and the record $590 billion drop in the market value of US chipmaker Nvidia. Spooking the markets is the announcement that a Chinese startup can operate its latest AI model 18 times cheaper than Sam Altman's GPT-4. Is DeepSeek for real? Why the sudden surprise? If it upends America's dominance of artificial intelligence, does that mean a democratisation of global information systems or a showdown between superpowers that ultimately decides who rules the world?

246.title: Danish PM marshals European support against Trump's threats to Greenland

385.title: Opinion: Trump promised to end the Ukraine war, but neither side is ready
385.summary: As Eisenhower once said of how conflicts end, 'sometimes it just gets down to the dirty job of killing until one side or the other cracks.'
385.author: ML Cavanaugh

386.title: Stranded in Mexico City, these migrants hoping to reach the United States have no good options
386.summary: The 1,500 migrants living in this Mexico City encampment face hard choices with President Trump in office.
386.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

387.title: Community groups set up strike teams to respond to Trump's mass deportation plans
387.summary: Community groups are dusting off the rapid-response networks they built during President Trump's first administration to prepare for immigration sweeps in California's agricultural heartland.
387.author: Rebecca Plevin

388.title: Visiting L.A. after firestorm, Trump focuses on overhauling California water policy
388.summary: President Trump says he plans to issue an order to 'open up the pumps' and deliver more water from the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta to California farms and cities.
388.author: Ian James

389.title: Supreme Court will decide if religious schools may be funded as public charters
389.summary: The Supreme Court agreed to hear a new church-state case that could yield a potentially momentous decision and change the funding of public schools in much of the nation.
389.author: David G. Savage

390.title: Trump revokes the security detail of Dr. Anthony Fauci, who has faced death threats
390.summary: Trump revoked the security for Dr. Anthony Fauci, the infectious disease expert and former advisor turned critic who faces regular threats to his life.
390.author: Associated Press and Times staff

391.title: Cease-fire in Gaza Strip was widely welcomed. It may not last. Here's why
391.summary: Powerful forces in Middle East and, now, in Washington working against truce lasting beyond its first phase.
391.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King

392.title: Opinion: It's now clear that America's death penalty is dying one generation at a time
392.summary: Capital punishment has continued to become rarer in recent years, and public opinion of the practice keeps growing dimmer with time.
392.author: Austin Sarat

393.title: Meet the first couples to wed as Thailand legalizes same-sex marriage
393.summary: Thailand has long been known as a haven for LGBTQ+ communities. It is only the third place in Asia to legalize same-sex marriage, behind Taiwan in 2019 and Nepal in 2023.
393.author: Stephanie Yang

394.title: Trump's rebuke to 'gender ideology' changes federal policy and sets up clash with California
394.summary: The executive order conflicts with laws in California and other blue states that forbid discrimination based on gender identity. The courts are expected to take up the issue.
394.author: David G. Savage

395.title: Under Trump, we could be flying blind when it comes to bird flu, other infectious diseases
395.summary: President Trump announced he's pulling the U.S. from the WHO. Now researchers are scrambling to understand what that means for the H5N1 bird flu pandemic.
395.author: Susanne Rust

396.title: Alawites wary as a post-Assad Syria takes shape
396.summary: Once Syria's most influential minority, Alawites struggle to move on from their association with a hated dictator.
396.author: Nabih Bulos

397.title: U.S. and Australia have long fought fires together. Climate change threatens joint efforts
397.summary: U.S. officials didn't even bother to ask Australia for help battling the Los Angeles fires.
397.author: Max Kim, Maria Petrakis

398.title: Less process than 'a traffic ticket': ACLU sues to stop Trump's fast-track deportation policy
398.summary: ACLU sues to stop Trump policy that allows immediate deportation of some immigrants. The new policy could pave the way for mass expulsions.
398.author: Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga

399.title: 'Scare tactic': Bonta slams Trump move targeting local officials over immigration
399.summary: The Department of Justice is planning to investigate and possibly prosecute state and local officials who hinder Trump administration immigration efforts.
399.author: Faith E. Pinho, Keri Blakinger, Ruben Vives

400.title: Calmes: President Trump's Jan. 6 pardons broke his promise to the nation
400.summary: The new/old president seems to have a memory issue. 'You will pay,' he told Jan. 6 lawbreakers in 2021. You're free to go, he said Monday.
400.author: Jackie Calmes

401.title: 'Freaked out': Fear, uncertainty grip California's immigrant community as Trump rolls out crackdown plan
401.summary: Worry spreads over what Trump's orders will mean for California immigrants. One in eight state residents are undocumented or live with a family member who is.
401.author: Ruben Vives, Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga, Rebecca Plevin

402.title: Biden, Harris in California, and soon Trump will be too
402.summary: Former President Biden and former First Lady Jill Biden are spending their first days after leaving the White House in Santa Barbara County.
402.author: Seema Mehta

403.title: Musk says his gestures at Trump inauguration event weren't Nazi salutes
403.summary: Musk made the gestures during a giddy speech celebrating Trump's return to power at a rally Monday at Capital One Arena in Washington. Many condemn the gestures, but not the ADL.
403.author: Kevin Rector

404.title: What did Trump's team learn from past legal battles? Immigrant advocates prepare to find out
404.summary: Immigrants rights groups are already contesting President Trump's sweeping executive orders aimed at combating illegal immigration.
404.author: Andrea Castillo

405.title: Mexico's president reacts to Trump moves on immigration, border and cartels. 'It's nothing new'
405.summary: Mexico's President Sheinbaum says she will work with Trump on deportations, border issues and cartels, but laughs at his 'Gulf of America' order.
405.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

406.title: Jan. 6 rioters freed by Trump include Californians and those who assaulted officers
406.summary: Rioters who were convicted and imprisoned for their roles in the violent attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6 were being released after receiving pardons and commutations from Trump.
406.author: Brittny Mejia, Kevin Rector

407.title: Column: How Donald Trump's second inauguration outdid the cruelty and excesses of his first
407.summary: The president freed the Jan. 6 insurrectionists, disparaged California firefighters and welcomed the members of a new American oligarchy to Washington.
407.author: Robin Abcarian

408.title: California, other states sue to block Trump executive order on birthright citizenship
408.summary: California, a coalition of other states and the city of San Francisco have sued the Trump administration over President Trump's executive order aimed at ending birthright citizenship, calling it unconstitutional.
408.author: Kevin Rector

409.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says she used her access to nudge Trump on L.A. wildfire recovery
409.summary: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar, the chief of the inaugural transition, acknowledged the difficulty of overseeing the handoff of power to President Trump in the site where his followers sought to violently overturn his election defeat four years ago.
409.author: Seema Mehta

410.title: Trump orders federal agencies to recognize only two sexes that are 'not changeable'
410.summary: President Trump signed executive orders Monday asserting that the U.S. government recognizes only two sexes that are "not changeable," and reversing Biden administration directives on LGBTQ+ rights.
410.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

411.title: 'Drill baby drill': Trump takes aim at clean energy, climate change and the environment on day one
411.summary: In his first day as the 47th U.S. president, Donald Trump took action to reverse many of the Biden administration's efforts to move the country toward a green-energy economy.
411.author: Tony Briscoe, Karen Kaplan

412.title: Trump pledges to restore McKinley's name to tallest peak in North America
412.summary: The pledge to rename Denali was opposed by environmental groups and Alaskan politicians, including Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski.
412.author: Lila Seidman

413.title: Trump signs orders to crack down on immigration, send troops to the border
413.summary: President Trump signed executive orders that will fundamentally change how the nation handles immigration, beefing up enforcement and deportations.
413.author: Andrea Castillo, Rachel Uranga

414.title: Column: His first day back in office confirms it — there is no Trump 2.0
414.summary: President Trump promised an inaugural address focused on "unity," but what he delivered was long on promises and anger toward opponents.
414.author: Doyle McManus

415.title: 'We're taking it back.' Trump's comments on the Panama Canal spur pushback from Panama
415.summary: 'We're taking it back.' Trump inauguration speech claim that the U.S. will regain control of the Panama Canal spurs immediate reaction in Panama.
415.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

416.title: Trump immediately flexes presidential powers: 1,500 pardons and a raft of executive orders
416.summary: President Trump flexed his presidential powers Monday, promising executive orders to usher in his agenda. He issued 1,500 pardons, after President Biden issued his own.
416.author: Kevin Rector

417.title: Scenes from a packed Rotunda: Moguls, former presidents — and some notable absences
417.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
417.author: Seema Mehta

418.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
418.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
418.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

419.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
419.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
419.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

420.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
420.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
420.author: A.T. McWilliams

421.title: Trump is sworn in as the nation's 47th president, capping historic comeback
421.summary: Donald Trump took the oath of office to become the 47th president in a historic Inauguration Day.
421.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho, James Rainey, Hailey Branson-Potts

422.title: RFK Jr. wants to improve Americans' health. Here's some advice from the outgoing FDA chief
422.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. has big plans for the FDA if he's confirmed as Secretary of Health and Human Services. FDA Commissioner Robert Califf explains why certain changes may not be that easy — or desirable.
422.author: Karen Kaplan

423.title: Cease-fire between Israel and Hamas begins with hostages being handed over
423.summary: Three hostages were handed over to Israeli forces — the first of 33 expected to be freed over the next six weeks in exchange for some 1,900 Palestinians. The deal follows months of negotiations.
423.author: Nabih Bulos, Bilal Shbair

424.title: News Analysis: Once again, the world sizes up a Trump presidency
424.summary: As Donald Trump takes the oath of office again, the world watches with a sense that, this time, those outside the U.S. have a better idea what to expect.
424.author: Laura King, Tracy Wilkinson

425.title: Opinion: If Martin Luther King Jr. were alive, how would he have approached the Trump era?
425.summary: The president-elect's inauguration takes place on the holiday honoring the civil rights leader, prompting us to consider how King might respond to Trump's America.
425.author: Earl Ofari Hutchinson

426.title: Opinion: Experts once thought highly of Biden's presidency. Here's how his legacy is likely to change
426.summary: A year ago, a survey of presidential scholars put him in the top third of chief executives while Trump ranked last. But that was before the 2024 election and campaign.
426.author: Brandon Rottinghaus and Justin Vaughn

427.title: Trump's first inaugural speech was 'American carnage.' He says this time will be different
427.summary: Will Trump take the opportunity this time, in his second inaugural speech, to talk of unity? Or will it be more 'American carnage'?
427.author: Doyle McManus

428.title: Column: Why's it so hard to do the right thing and honor the true heroes of Jan. 6?
428.summary: Nearly three years after passage of legislation to place a commemorative plaque on the western front of the Capitol there is still no action. Speaker Mike Johnson and other Trump allies are trying to bury history.
428.author: Mark Z. Barabak

429.title: Calmes: Biden delivered a new 'Roaring '20s.' Watch Trump try to take the credit
429.summary: No matter what the new president says, the facts show that Joe Biden left America in better economic shape than he found it.
429.author: Jackie Calmes

430.title: Supporters of South Korea's Yoon storm courthouse. Some see hope in Trump's return
430.summary: South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol's supporters storm the courthouse that issued a warrant extending his detention, climbing walls and smashing windows.
430.author: Max Kim

431.title: Trump expected to survey Los Angeles-area wildfire damage this week
431.summary: President-elect Donald Trump, in perhaps his first official trip after being inaugurated Monday, will likely visit the Los Angeles area to survey wildfire damage late next week.
431.author: Seema Mehta

432.title: Supreme Court will decide if parents may reject LGBTQ+ lessons for their kids
432.summary: Supreme Court will take up a dispute over grade school textbooks that include LGBTQ+ themes, pitting religious rights against individual rights.
432.author: David G. Savage

433.title: Brad Pitt's team reminds fans he's not on social media after a woman gets big-time scammed
433.summary: Brad Pitt is not on social media, his team reminded fans, after a French woman said she was conned out of $800,000 by scammers posing as the A-list actor.
433.author: Nardine Saad

434.title: Supreme Court upholds law that could force TikTok to shut down in U.S.
434.summary: Congress and now the Supreme Court say TikTok must separate itself from its Chinese owners or shut down operations in the U.S.
434.author: David G. Savage

435.title: Joan Plowright, award-winning 'Enchanted April' and 'Stalin' actor, dies at 95
435.summary: Joan Plowright, the celebrated English actor whose career included the films 'Enchanted April,' 'The Entertainer' and 'Spiderwick Chronicles,' has died at 95.
435.author: Alexandra Del Rosario

436.title: Opinion: What a century-old disaster can teach fire-ravaged L.A. about recovery and rebuilding
436.summary: Some in the fire-ravaged city have taken to laying personal blame. But what endures from the Canadian disaster is the generosity of those who helped rebuild.
436.author: Ben Proudfoot

437.title: Migration across the U.S.-Mexico border, in 5 charts
437.summary: Arrivals at the border are the lowest they've been since incoming President Trump first left office in 2021.
437.author: Andrea Castillo, Koko Nakajima

438.title: Trump made many 'Day 1' promises. Will he make good on them?
438.summary: President-elect Donald Trump could start taking action Monday on his many "Day 1" campaign promises, but California officials and others are ready to fight.
438.author: Kevin Rector

439.title: Bitter feud among Sinaloa cartel families brings grim new tactic: Grave desecration
439.summary: In the escalating war among rival factions of Mexico's Sinaloa cartel, sons of Joaquín "El Chapo" Guzmán are suspected of ordering the destruction of elaborate mausoleums that belong to rival families, including one for a fallen grandson of Ismael "El Mayo" Zambada.
439.author: Keegan Hamilton

440.title: Fire lessons from the Australian capital, where a 2003 inferno changed everything
440.summary: Two decades ago, fire ripped through Canberra, destroying 480 homes. An Australian fire chief reflects on possible lessons for California.
440.author: Max Kim

441.title: Padilla hopes to increase firefighter pay, create affordable housing for disaster response
441.summary: California Sen. Alex Padilla introduced several bills to increase firefighter pay, expand FEMA funding and include affordable housing as part of disaster response.
441.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

442.title: Harris joins a decades-old tradition for vice presidents in her final days in office
442.summary: Vice President Kamala Harris, in one of her last public appearances in the role, signed her ceremonial desk drawer at the White House on Thursday, a tradition that dates back nearly a century.
442.author: Seema Mehta

443.title: Rep. Nancy Pelosi will not attend Trump's inauguration
443.summary: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi (D-San Francisco) will not attend the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump.
443.author: Kevin Rector

444.title: Calmes: The case of the missing Hegseth investigation
444.summary: Trump's unfit nominee for Defense secretary gets the benefit of an incomplete, half-baked and secret FBI report.
444.author: Jackie Calmes

445.title: What will Mexico do if Trump tries to mass deport non-Mexicans across the border?
445.summary: How will Mexican leaders respond if, as expected, Trump pressures them to accept deportees from third countries? 'Mexico is in a really tough spot.'
445.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

446.title: Supreme Court leans in favor of state-enforced age limits on porn websites
446.summary: Can Texas and other red states limit children from instant access to vast amounts of online pornography? The Supreme Court will decide.
446.author: David G. Savage

447.title: Neil Gaiman denies sexual assault allegations: 'I don't accept there was any abuse'
447.summary: Neil Gaiman, the bestselling fantasy author, denies sexual abuse allegations made by eight women in an explosive New York Magazine article.
447.author: Nardine Saad

448.title: The FDA knew long ago that red dye No. 3 causes cancer. Why did it take so long to ban it?
448.summary: The FDA banned the use of red dye No. 3 in foods and medicines sold in the U.S. because it has been shown to cause cancer in rats. The action highlights the limits of a federal law known as the Delaney clause.
448.author: Karen Kaplan

449.title: Sen. Marco Rubio appears set to win confirmation as secretary of State
449.summary: Rubio and Trump have put aside past acrimony to make the Florida lawmaker the least controversial in an unusual slate of Cabinet picks.
449.author: Tracy Wilkinson

450.title: Cease-fire deal reached between Israel and Hamas in Gaza
450.summary: A cease-fire deal, announced by U.S. and Qatari mediators, promises to end more than a year of conflict in Gaza Strip. Some Israeli hostages would be exchanged for Palestinian prisoners under the agreement.
450.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King, Nabih Bulos

451.title: Trump's tariffs brought China and Mexico closer. Will his second term change that?
451.summary: China has strengthened trade with Latin America at the expense of the U.S. But Donald Trump, who threatens to raise tariffs on Mexico, could upend those ties.
451.author: Stephanie Yang

452.title: Biden administration to lift 'terrorism' designation on Cuba
452.summary: In its waning days, the first Trump administration put Cuba on terrorism list. Biden is removing it.
452.author: Tracy Wilkinson

453.title: 'TikTok refugees' unexpectedly turn to Chinese alternative as ban looms
453.summary: A number of TikTok users appear to be turning to an app called RedNote — more commonly known to its majority-Chinese audience by its Chinese name, Xiaohongshu.
453.author: Stephanie Yang, Xin-yun Wu

454.title: The Senate is considering the Laken Riley Act. Here's what it would do
454.summary: The bill would require immigration officers to detain immigrants who are suspected of minor theft and cede some federal immigration enforcement power to states.
454.author: Andrea Castillo

455.title: Kate Middleton's cancer is now in remission: 'It takes time to adjust to a new normal'
455.summary: Catherine, Princess of Wales, confirmed Tuesday that her cancer is in remission during a visit with the staff and patients of the Royal Marsden in Chelsea.
455.author: Nardine Saad

456.title: Special counsel report says Trump would've been convicted for 'unprecedented criminal effort' in Jan. 6 case
456.summary: The report, arriving just days before Trump is to return to office, focuses fresh attention on his failed effort to cling to power after his election loss in 2020.
456.author: Alanna Durkin Richer, Eric Tucker and Colleen Long

457.title: Supreme Court denies oil industry plea to block climate lawsuits filed by California, other blue states
457.summary: Supreme Court will not block California's suit against big oil companies for damage from climate change.
457.author: David G. Savage

458.title: Column: Trump wants to grab control of Greenland, Canada and the Panama Canal. He's already bungled it
458.summary: Trump wants to take Greenland from Denmark, make Canada the 51st state and retake the Panama Canal, threats reflecting his view that might makes right.
458.author: Doyle McManus

459.title: Newsom suspends landmark environmental laws to ease rebuilding in wildfire zones
459.summary: Gov. Gavin Newsom on Sunday signed an executive order suspending parts of the Coastal Act and the California Environmental Quality Act to aid homeowners rebuilding after losses in last week's wildfires.
459.author: Seema Mehta, Liam Dillon, Rosanna Xia

460.title: Calmes: Merrick Garland's integrity saved the DOJ only to doom it again
460.summary: Atty. Gen. Merrick Garland's uprightness rescued the Department of Justice from Donald Trump's grip. But then he handed it over again.
460.author: Jackie Calmes

461.title: 'This is your Hurricane Katrina': Assessing the long road ahead for L.A.
461.summary: Craig Fugate, who led the Federal Emergency Management Agency in the Obama administration, has seen a lot of natural disasters.
461.author: Kevin Rector

462.title: Opinion: Why Israel can't just 'cut the head off' of Hamas or Hezbollah
462.summary: These groups are organic and homegrown, unlike the Islamic State or Al Qaeda, which have relied heavily on fighters from abroad. Hamas and Hezbollah will replenish their ranks with locals.
462.author: Colin P. Clarke

463.title: Column: 'Are you OK?' Thank you for asking about us in fire-ravaged L.A.
463.summary: If you live in Southern California, you're getting the messages via text, email, IMs, chats and every other way imaginable: People worldwide asking if you are safe.
463.author: Lorraine Ali

464.title: 'They just got my uncle': Immigration arrests spark fear among farmworkers in Central Valley
464.summary: Dozens have been arrested in the heavily agricultural Kern County during a multiple-day operation by U.S. Customs and Border Protection.
464.author: Rachel Uranga, Andrea Castillo

465.title: What new Trump order means for trans children
465.author: TOI World Desk

466.title: M23 rebels expand their control of Goma in eastern Congo
466.summary: Rwanda-backed M23 rebels have captured large parts of Goma, including its airport, intensifying the ongoing conflict in eastern Congo. The battle left many dead and displaced, with international calls for a ceasefire. Rwanda denies backing M23, while accusations from the UN suggest up to 4,000 Rwandan forces are involved. Pope Francis has urged for peace, and analysts warn that securing a rebel withdrawal may prove more difficult than in previous clashes.

467.title: Dolton mayor Tiffany Henyard called bi**h by activist, her boyfriend punches him in viral video
467.summary: At a heated Dolton Township board meeting, activist Jedidiah Brown's inflammatory comments towards mayor Tiffany Henyard resulted in a physical altercation with Henyard's boyfriend, Kamal Woods. Henyard joined the fights and was thrown onto the ground. Police intervened, ending the meeting early without arrests. "You gone, bi**h," Brown said in the meeting.
467.author: TOI World Desk

468.title: Trump makes moves to expand his power, sparking chaos and a possible constitutional crisis
468.summary: President Donald Trump's recent move to halt federal payments for diversity programs has sparked controversy, with critics arguing it violates the constitution’s separation of powers. Legal experts contend the president cannot block congressionally approved spending. Court challenges have already emerged, and Trump’s broader actions, including challenging birthright citizenship and firing inspectors general, raise concerns about overstepping constitutional limits. While many republicans support his approach, democrats criticize the threat to congressional authority.

469.title: Israeli father says even in Hamas captivity, his daughter heard his pleas to come home alive

471.title: Who is Mark Milley? Trump critic whose security detail was removed by Pete Hegseth
471.summary: Retired US General Mark Milley faces a political upheaval after US defence secretary Pete Hegseth revoked his security clearance and detail, and called for an inspector-general review to assess if his rank should be reduced. The move highlights tensions during Milley's service under Trump, his controversial decisions, and alleged overstepping of his role.
471.author: TOI World Desk

472.title: Yemen: Increased repression halts humanitarian aid

473.title: Panama Canal: What's at stake for China amid US threats?
473.summary: Marco Rubio, as the new U.S. Secretary of State, will visit Panama amid concerns over China's growing influence on the Panama Canal. President Trump's claim that China has control of the canal has sparked discussions about U.S. and Panamanian sovereignty and China’s strategic intentions.

474.title: 'Afraid of strong leaders': Zelenskyy reacts to Putin refusing to directly speak with Ukraine President
474.summary: Russian President Vladimir Putin has expressed willingness for peace talks with Ukraine but refuses to negotiate directly with President Zelenskyy, calling him 'illegitimate.' Zelenskyy has accused Putin of prolonging the war and manipulating negotiations. The conflict continues with ongoing drone attacks and territorial advances by Russian forces amid US pressure for peace.
474.author: TOI World Desk

475.title: 85% Greenlanders oppose joining the US: Poll
475.summary: A recent opinion poll found that 85% of Greenlanders oppose joining the US, despite President Trump's claims that they are enthusiastic about it. Greenland's Prime Minister maintains that the island is not for sale, emphasizing that any decision regarding their future should be made by the people.

476.title: US: F-35 fighter jet crashes during training in Alaska’s Eielson Air Force base
476.summary: An F-35 fighter jet crashed during a training exercise at Eielson Air Force Base in Alaska, with the pilot safely ejecting and in stable condition. The incident occurred during landing, and a malfunction was reported. Authorities are investigating the cause to prevent future crashes. There were no other injuries reported.
476.author: TOI World Desk

477.title: Trump's immigration raids gain support in NYC’s minority communities: Report
477.summary: Recent immigration raids in New York City targeted individuals with criminal records, notably in Hispanic and Black communities. While some residents expressed relief regarding the arrests of dangerous criminals, concerns remain about the potential impact on law-abiding migrant families.
477.author: TOI World Desk

478.title: What is a Gale warning? All you need to know
478.summary: A gale warning alerts the public and nautical communities of strong winds, dangerous for coastal and maritime areas. With speeds of 34-47 knots, these warnings help prevent hazards. Issued by agencies like the NWS, gale warnings inform through various channels, emphasizing the importance of keeping safe during these critical weather events.
478.author: TOI World Desk

479.title: Donald Trump restricts 'gender-affirming care' for those under 19
479.summary: President Trump has signed an executive order limiting gender transition procedures for individuals under 19, including restrictions on puberty blockers, hormone treatments, and surgeries. This order ends federal funding for such procedures and aims to enforce laws against these medical practices. Trump labels gender-affirming care as barbaric and medically destructive.
479.author: TOI World Desk

480.title: Kim Jong Un visits nuclear facility, calls for expansion after Donald Trump says he'll 'reach out' again
480.summary: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un’s inspection of a nuclear material facility indicates the nation's continued effort to bolster its nuclear arsenal. Despite President Donald Trump’s readiness for renewed diplomacy, North Korea appears steadfast in its strategy to enhance its military capabilities and leverage negotiations with the US.
480.author: TOI World Desk

481.title: Prince Harry reveals contacting late mother Princess Diana through psychic in his memoir
481.summary: Prince Harry reveals his emotional experience of contacting his late mother, Princess Diana, through a psychic in his memoir, Spare. Diana reassured Harry that he was living the life she wanted for him. The memoir also shares an anecdote involving his son's mishap with a Christmas ornament and a symbolic encounter with a leopard during a trip to Botswana.
481.author: TOI World Desk

482.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' ex asst claims he was forced to have sex to prove 'loyalty'
482.summary: Sean 'Diddy' Combs' former assistant, Phillip Pines, alleges he was forced into sexual activity to prove loyalty at a party hosted by Combs. Pines recounts the incident and his fear of retaliation. Combs faces charges of sex trafficking, racketeering, and other accusations while denying all claims.
482.author: TOI World Desk

483.title: 'Elon will be on his way': Trump says SpaceX to rescue stranded Nasa astronauts 'soon'
483.summary: President Trump announced that SpaceX will soon launch a mission to bring home Nasa astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams from the ISS, where they've been stranded due to technical issues with Boeing's Starliner. Originally a short stay, their return was delayed. Elon Musk confirmed the expedited mission, which aims to safely return the astronauts.
483.author: TOI World Desk

484.title: US man Carl Bennett impersonates immigration agent to threaten woman into sex
484.summary: A man in North Carolina has been charged with multiple crimes for breaking into a motel, pretending to be an ICE agent, and threatening a woman with deportation unless she engaged in sexual acts. He faces charges including kidnapping, rape, and possessing cocaine. This incident raises concerns about the exploitation and impersonation of immigration officers in the US.
484.author: TOI World Desk

485.title: Only 6% of Greenlanders want to join US – Danish poll
485.summary:
Only 6% of Greenlanders want to join US, a Danish poll has found, with 45% saying they see Trump’s interest in the island as a threat
Read Full Article at RT.com
485.author: RT

486.title: Trump wants Musk to ‘go get’ astronauts stuck in space
486.summary:
Trump wants Musk to ‘go get’ NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams, who’ve been stuck on the Space Station for seven months
Read Full Article at RT.com
486.author: RT

487.title: France could deploy troops to Greenland – FM
487.summary:
Jean-Noel Barrot’s remarks come amid tensions between Denmark and the US, with President Trump demanding the island be ceded to Washington
Read Full Article at RT.com
487.author: RT

488.title: EU to place tariffs on Russian fertilizers
488.summary:
Levies on certain nitrogen-based fertilizers will jump to a “prohibitive” level over the next three years, the European Commission has said
Read Full Article at RT.com
488.author: RT

489.title: NATO country stops training Ukrainian doctors following Trump order
489.summary:
Latvia’s top rehabilitation center says it hopes to be able to resume the training program once US funding is restored
Read Full Article at RT.com
489.author: RT

490.title: Justice for Ruben Vardanyan: A сall for reconciliation and peace in the South Caucasus
490.summary:
The controversial case of a former Nagorno-Karabakh leader is a question of what kind of future the region envisions for itself.
Read Full Article at RT.com
490.author: RT

491.title: OpenAI promises close cooperation with US authorities
491.summary:
The company behind ChatGPT is pursuing “countermeasures to protect” its IP amid the rapid growth of Chinese competitor DeepSeek
Read Full Article at RT.com
491.author: RT

492.title: Prototype jet breaches sound barrier in historic flight
492.summary:
Boom Supersonic’s XB-1 jet has become the first independently developed aircraft to reach Mach 1.1
Read Full Article at RT.com
492.author: RT

705.title: An Exorbitant Privilege for All?
705.summary:
DAKAR, Senegal / KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia, Jan 29 (IPS) - Ending US dollar dominance alone will not end monetary imperialism. Only much better multilateral arrangements to clear international payments can meet the Global South’s aspirations for sustainable development.

Read the full story, “An Exorbitant Privilege for All?”, on globalissues.org →

706.title: Antisemitism On The Rise Among Younger Generations
706.summary:
UNITED NATIONS, Jan 28 (IPS) - The United Nations (UN) held the annual Holocaust Memorial Ceremony on January 27 with the theme "Holocaust Remembrance for Dignity and Human Rights". This year - 2025 - marks the 80 year anniversary of the end of World War II and the liberation of Nazi concentration camps that resulted in the deaths of over 6 million Jews. This event included testimonies from Holocaust survivors, underscoring the importance of understanding and remembrance. With Holocaust denial and attacks on Jews on the rise, it is important to take meaningful steps as a society to combat racism and antisemitism.

Read the full story, “Antisemitism On The Rise Among Younger Generations”, on globalissues.org →
